abstract_summ: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a highly contagious illness caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) Pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) are the most common severe complications . There is growing evidence regarding the imaging findings of the disease in chest X-rays and computed tomography (CT) scans . However, their availability to clinical staff in this pandemic outbreak might be compromised . At this moment, the role of lung ultrasound (LUS) has yet to be explored .
